intro: Hieracium harzianum, commonly known as the Harz hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow-orange flower heads composed of numerous small florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium harzianum is often found in nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
